cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 120 mi SE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn west on Thursday, then west-northwest Friday and northwest Saturday, tracking toward the central Louisiana coast and then north into Arkansas/Missouri early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City–Cameron area
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (Kansas City is an inland port, no coastal exit)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch: Mouth of the Pearl River to Intracoastal City, LA;  Hurricane Watch: Mouth of Mississippi River to Cameron, LA; Tropical Storm Watch: Mouth of Mississippi River northward to Pearl River, MS
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast of Louisiana and adjacent Mississippi coast
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty winds possible early next week but expected to remain below tropical-storm force
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1–3 inches of rain to western Missouri early next week, locally higher in bands
weather_observation.other_hazards: Growing risk of river and flash flooding on already-elevated Missouri River and tributaries, which could disrupt barge traffic and wharf operations even without direct wind impacts
